Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Needle (?)
Description: This oblong copper object is extremely oxidised and has a shape generally comparable to that of a needle. The body is rectangular. The top extremity is rectangular but slightly flattened. The other extremity changes into a rounded section and ends with a pointed tip. If this was indeed a needle, the eye no longer exists. This object was found along with two others that are relatively similar.
